item.text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
“Speak to the Israelites and tell them, ‘When a man makes a special votive offering based on the conversion value of a person to the Lord,

the <st data-num="06187" class="">conversion value</st> of the <st data-num="02145" class="">male</st><n id="1" /> from <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">up to</st> <st data-num="08346" class="">sixty</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="01961" class="">is</st> <st data-num="02572" class="">50</st> <st data-num="08255 03701">shekels</st> by the standard of the <st data-num="06944" class="">sanctuary</st> <st data-num="08255" class="">shekel</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> the <st data-num="01931" class="">person</st> is a <st data-num="05347" class="">female</st>, the <st data-num="06187" class="">conversion value</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">is</st> <st data-num="07970" class="">30</st> <st data-num="08255" class="">shekels</st>.

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> the person is from <st data-num="02568" class="">five</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">up to</st> <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st>, the <st data-num="06187" class="">conversion value</st> of the <st data-num="02145" class="">male</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">is</st> <st data-num="06242" class="">20</st> <st data-num="08255" class="">shekels</st>, and for the <st data-num="05347" class="">female</st> <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> <st data-num="08255" class="">shekels</st>.

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> the person is one <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">up to</st> <st data-num="02568" class="">five</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st>, the <st data-num="06187" class="">conversion value</st> of the <st data-num="02145" class="">male</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">is</st> <st data-num="02568" class="">five</st> <st data-num="08255" class="">shekels</st> of <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>,<n id="1" /> and for the <st data-num="05347" class="">female</st> the <st data-num="06187" class="">conversion value</st> is <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="08255" class="">shekels</st> of <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>.

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> the person is from <st data-num="08346" class="">sixty</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> and <st data-num="04605" class="">older</st>, <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> he is a <st data-num="02145" class="">male</st>, the <st data-num="06187" class="">conversion value</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">is</st> <st data-num="02568 06240">15</st> <st data-num="08255" class="">shekels</st>, and for the <st data-num="05347" class="">female</st> <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> <st data-num="08255" class="">shekels</st>.

If the person making the votive offering is too poor to pay the conversion value, he must stand the person before the priest, and the priest will establish his conversion value; according to what the man who made the votive offering can afford, the priest will establish his conversion value.
“‘If what is vowed is a kind of animal from which an offering may be presented to the Lord, anything which he gives to the Lord from this kind of animal will be holy.

He must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="02498" class="">replace</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">or</st> <st data-num="04171" class="">exchange</st> it, <st data-num="02896" class="">good</st> for <st data-num="07451" class="">bad</st> <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> <st data-num="07451" class="">bad</st> for <st data-num="02896" class="">good</st>, and <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> he does <st data-num="04171" class="">indeed</st> <st data-num="04171" class="">exchange</st> one <st data-num="0929" class="">animal</st> for another <st data-num="0929" class="">animal</st>, then both <st data-num="01931" class="">the original animal</st><n id="1" /> and its <st data-num="08545" class="">substitute</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> <st data-num="06944" class="">holy</st>.
If what is vowed is an unclean animal from which an offering must not be presented to the Lord, then he must stand the animal before the priest,

and the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> will <st data-num="06186" class="">establish</st> its <st data-num="06186" class="">conversion value</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0996" class="">whether</st> <st data-num="02896" class="">good</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">or</st> <st data-num="07451" class="">bad</st>. According to the <st data-num="06187" class="">conversion value</st> assessed by the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st>, <st data-num="03651" class="">thus</st> it will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st>.
If, however, the person who made the vow redeems the animal, he must add one-fifth to its conversion value.
“‘If a man consecrates his house as holy to the Lord, the priest will establish its conversion value, whether good or bad. Just as the priest establishes its conversion value, thus it will stand.
If the one who consecrates it redeems his house, he must add to it one-fifth of its conversion value in silver, and it will belong to him.

“‘If a man consecrates to the Lord some of his own landed property, the conversion value must be calculated in accordance with the amount of seed needed to sow it, a homer of barley seed being priced at 50 shekels of silver.

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> he <st data-num="06942" class="">consecrates</st> his <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st> in the <st data-num="03104" class="">Jubilee</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st>,<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="06187" class="">conversion value</st> will <st data-num="06965" class="">stand</st>,

but <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st><n id="1" /> he <st data-num="06942" class="">consecrates</st> his <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> the <st data-num="03104" class="">Jubilee</st>, the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> will <st data-num="02803" class="">calculate</st> the <st data-num="03701" class="">price</st><n id="2" /> for him <st data-num="05921 06310">according to</st> the <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> that are <st data-num="03498" class="">left</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> the next <st data-num="03104" class="">Jubilee</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st>, and it will be <st data-num="01639" class="">deducted</st> from the <st data-num="06187" class="">conversion value</st>.

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st>, <st data-num="01350" class="">however</st>, the one who <st data-num="06942" class="">consecrated</st> the <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st> <st data-num="01350" class="">redeems</st> it,<n id="1" /> he must <st data-num="03254" class="">add</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> it <st data-num="02549" class="">one-fifth</st> of the <st data-num="06187" class="">conversion</st> <st data-num="03701" class="">price</st>,<n id="2" /> and it will <st data-num="06965" class="">belong</st> to him.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> he does <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01350" class="">redeem</st> the <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st>, <st data-num="0518" class="">but</st> <st data-num="04376" class="">sells</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st> to <st data-num="0376" class="">someone</st> <st data-num="0312" class="">else</st>, he may <st data-num="03808 05750">never</st> <st data-num="01350" class="">redeem</st> it.
When it reverts in the Jubilee, the field will be holy to the Lord like a permanently dedicated field; it will become the priest’s property.
“‘If he consecrates to the Lord a field he has purchased, which is not part of his own landed property,
the priest will calculate for him the amount of its conversion value until the Jubilee year, and he must pay the conversion value on that Jubilee day as something that is holy to the Lord.

In the <st data-num="03104" class="">Jubilee</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st> the <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st> will <st data-num="07725" class="">return</st> to the <st data-num="0834" class="">one</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">from</st> whom he <st data-num="07069" class="">bought</st> it, the <st data-num="0834" class="">one</st> to whom it belongs as <st data-num="0776" class="">landed</st> <st data-num="0272" class="">property</st>.
Every conversion value must be calculated by the standard of the sanctuary shekel; 20 gerahs to the shekel.
“‘Surely no man may consecrate a firstborn that already belongs to the Lord as a firstborn among the animals; whether it is an ox or a sheep, it belongs to the Lord.

If, however, it is among the unclean animals, he may ransom it according to its conversion value and must add one-fifth to it, but if it is not redeemed, it must be sold according to its conversion value.

“‘Surely anything that a man permanently dedicates to the Lord from all that belongs to him, whether from people, animals, or his landed property, must be neither sold nor redeemed; anything permanently dedicated is most holy to the Lord.
Any human being who is permanently dedicated to the Lord must not be ransomed; such a person must be put to death.
“‘Any tithe of the land, from the grain of the land or from the fruit of the trees, belongs to the Lord; it is holy to the Lord.

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> a <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="01350" class="">redeems</st><n id="1" /> part of his <st data-num="04643" class="">tithe</st>, <st data-num="01350" class="">however</st>, he must <st data-num="03254" class="">add</st> <st data-num="02549" class="">one-fifth</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> it.<n id="2" />
All the tithe of herds or flocks, everything which passes under the rod, the tenth one will be holy to the Lord.

The owner must not examine the animals to distinguish between good and bad, and he must not exchange it. If, however, he does exchange it, both the original animal and its substitute will be holy and must not be redeemed.’”
These are the commandments which the Lord commanded Moses to tell the Israelites at Mount Sinai.
